sentence.text: ALDACTONE (spironolactone) tablet, film coated
ALDACTONE (spironolactone) is indicated in the management of Primary hyperaldosteronism.
Potassium supplementation, either in the form of medication or as a diet rich in potassium, should not ordinarily be given in association with ALDACTONE therapy.

mmtx.phraseText: either in the form of medication

sentence.text: Excessive potassium intake may cause hyperkalemia in patients receiving ALDACTONE (see Precautions: General).
ALDACTONE should not be administered concurrently with other potassium-sparing diuretics.
ALDACTONE, when used with ACE inhibitors or indomethacin, even in the presence of a diuretic, has been associated with severe hyperkalemia.
Extreme caution should be exercised when ALDACTONE is given concomitantly with these drugs.

antecedentSentence.Text: ALDACTONE, when used with ACE inhibitors or indomethacin, even in the presence of a diuretic, has been associated with severe hyperkalemia.
ALDACTONE, when used with ACE inhibitors or indomethacin, even in the presence of a diuretic, has been associated with severe hyperkalemia.

sentence.text: It is critical to monitor and manage serum potassium in patients with severe heart failure receiving ALDACTONE.

mmtx.phraseText: with severe heart failure receiving ALDACTONE.

sentence.text: Avoid using other potassium-sparing diuretics.

ellipsisSentence.text: It is critical to monitor and manage serum potassium in patients with severe heart failure receiving ALDACTONE.

mmtx.phraseText: with severe heart failure receiving ALDACTONE.
with severe heart failure receiving ALDACTONE.

sentence.text: Avoid using oral potassium supplements in patients with serum potassium > 3.5 mEq/L.

ellipsisSentence.text: It is critical to monitor and manage serum potassium in patients with severe heart failure receiving ALDACTONE.

mmtx.phraseText: with severe heart failure receiving ALDACTONE.
with severe heart failure receiving ALDACTONE.

sentence.text: The recommended monitoring for potassium and creatinine is one week after initiation or increase in dose of ALDACTONE, monthly for the first 3 months, then quarterly for a year, and then every 6 months.
Lithium generally should not be given with diuretics (see Precautions: Drug interactions).
All patients receiving diuretic therapy should be observed for evidence of fluid or electrolyte imbalance, e.g., hypomagnesemia, hyponatremia, hypochloremic alkalosis, and hyperkalemia.
Consequently, no potassium supplement should ordinarily be given with ALDACTONE.
Concomitant administration of potassium-sparing diuretics and ACE inhibitors or nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), e.g., indomethacin, has been associated with severe hyperkalemia.

These may include the intravenous administration of calcium chloride solution, sodium bicarbonate solution and/or the oral or parenteral administration of glucose with a rapid-acting insulin preparation.

mmtx.phraseText: the intravenous administration of calcium chloride solution,

sentence.text: Dilutional hyponatremia, manifested by dryness of the mouth, thirst, lethargy, and drowsiness, and confirmed by a low serum sodium level, may be caused or aggravated, especially when ALDACTONE is administered in combination with other diuretics, and dilutional hyponatremia may occur in edematous patients in hot weather;

mmtx.phraseText: manifested by dryness of the mouth,

sentence.text: Concomitant administration of ACE inhibitors with potassium-sparing diuretics has been associated with severe hyperkalemia.
Alcohol, barbiturates, or narcotics
Potentiation of orthostatic hypotension may occur.
Intensified electrolyte depletion, particularly hypokalemia, may occur.
Pressor amines (e.g., norepinephrine)
ALDACTONE reduces the vascular responsiveness to norepinephrine.
Therefore, caution should be exercised in the management of patients subjected to regional or general anesthesia while they are being treated with ALDACTONE.
Skeletal muscle relaxants, nondepolarizing (e.g., tubocurarine)
Possible increased responsiveness to the muscle relaxant may result.

ellipsisSentence.text: ALDACTONE reduces the vascular responsiveness to norepinephrine.

middleSentence.text: Therefore, caution should be exercised in the management of patients subjected to regional or general anesthesia while they are being treated with ALDACTONE.

sentence.text: Lithium generally should not be given with diuretics.
Diuretic agents reduce the renal clearance of lithium and add a high risk of lithium toxicity.

mmtx.phraseText: a high risk of lithium toxicity.

sentence.text: In some patients, the administration of an NSAID can reduce the diuretic, natriuretic, and antihypertensive effect of loop, potassium-sparing, and thiazide diuretics.
Combination of NSAIDs, e.g., indomethacin, with potassium-sparing diuretics has been associated with severe hyperkalemia.
Therefore, when ALDACTONE and NSAIDs are used concomitantly, the patient should be observed closely to determine if the desired effect of the diuretic is obtained.
ALDACTONE has been shown to increase the half-life of digoxin.
This may result in increased serum digoxin levels and subsequent digitalis toxicity.

mmtx.phraseText: result in increased serum digoxin levels
result in increased serum digoxin levels

ellipsisSentence.text: ALDACTONE has been shown to increase the half-life of digoxin.
ALDACTONE has been shown to increase the half-life of digoxin.

sentence.text: It may be necessary to reduce the maintenance and digitalization doses when ALDACTONE is administered, and the patient should be carefully monitored to avoid over- or under-digitalization.

ellipsisSentence.text: This may result in increased serum digoxin levels and subsequent digitalis toxicity.
This may result in increased serum digoxin levels and subsequent digitalis toxicity.

sentence.text: Several reports of possible interference with digoxin radioimmunoassay by ALDACTONE, or its metabolites, have appeared in the literature.
If serum potassium increases during ALDACTONE administration but drops when ALDACTONE is discontinued, a presumptive diagnosis of primary hyperaldosteronism should be considered.
If, after five days, an adequate diuretic response to ALDACTONE has not occurred, a second diuretic that acts more proximally in the renal tubule may be added to the regimen.

mmtx.phraseText: an adequate diuretic response to ALDACTONE
an adequate diuretic response to ALDACTONE

sentence.text: Because of the additive effect of ALDACTONE when administered concurrently with such diuretics, an enhanced diuresis usually begins on the first day of combined treatment;

antecedentSentence.Text: If, after five days, an adequate diuretic response to ALDACTONE has not occurred, a second diuretic that acts more proximally in the renal tubule may be added to the regimen.

antecedentEntity.text: diuretic that acts more proximally in the renal tubule

sentence.text: The dosage of ALDACTONE should remain unchanged when other diuretic therapy is added.
ALDACTONE may also be given with diuretics that act more proximally in the renal tubule or with other antihypertensive agents.

ALDACTONE in a dosage ranging from 25 mg to 100 mg daily is useful in treating a diuretic-induced hypokalemia, when oral potassium supplements or other potassium-sparing regimens are considered inappropriate.
Treatment should be initiated with ALDACTONE 25 mg once daily if the patient's serum potassium is 5.0 mEq/L and the patient's serum creatinine is 2.5 mg/dL.
